item.title: Your Choice of Agent Can Kill Your Chances of Selling! - Jun 09,2012
item.description:
Choosing the right real estate agent does impact your chances of selling your home. In fact, it has been scientifically proven. Did you know that a price reduction can also significantly and negatively impact your selling time, and lower your final selling price? Want to take a chance on that rookie agent because theyre so personable and agressive? Dont do it! Find out why by joining us on this informative episode of The Property Beat as we talk with Dr. Bennie Waller, professor of real estate at Longwood University in Virginia. Hell share with us some of the incredible findings that his research has revealed about choice of real estate agent, proper pricing, and why experieince matters in todays market. Hosts Jonathan D Nicholas and Cliff Perotti will also share their insights from over 50 years of combined residential selling expertise.

item.title: Sold With Style: Creating Buyer Demand for Your Property! - Jun 02,2012
item.description:
If youve sold property, or are currently marketing property, you know that positioning your home to stand out from the clutter of competition is key in helping to get it sold. Are you having issues attracting buyers? Are you getting offers that are below your propertys value? Is your property languishing on the market and not getting the attention that it deserves? Join our hosts Cliff Perotti and Jonathan D Nicholas as they explore what keeps some properties from selling and yet others seem to sell in a matter of hours. Theyll be joined by guest, James Hart, CEO of Sold With Style, a real estate marketing and interior design firm in NYC. James will share with you some of the techniques that his firm utilizes to help a residence to become the HOT PROPERTY in a sea of real estate listings. If youre home is currently for sale, or you are contemplating putting your home on the market, youll not want to miss this episode.

item.title: Maximize Your ROI with Turnkey Investment Opportunities - May 26,2012
item.description:
Are you looking to invest, but you dont want to research the market, waste time or make the wrong decisions? Instead of being a "jack of trades" and doing all the work required to make a sound real estate investment, why not partner with others that have a proven strategy? Listen in on The Property Beat as hosts Cliff Perotti and Jonathan D Nicholas talk about turnkey investment strategies. Theyll be joined by guest, Kevin Conlon, CEO of Meridian Pacific Properties, Inc., a company that is on a mission to help investors just like you. Meridian Pacific Properties has seized the opportunity to assist investors by being the real estate expert at the center of the investment transaction. Ultimately, this leads to confidence and peace of mind because investors dont have to spend unnecessary time, money or energy trying to figure out the formula for success. So, what is that formula for success? Join us and find out on this timely and informative episode of the Property Beat.

item.title: Mortgage Fraud Still Exists - Especially on Wall Street! - May 12,2012
item.description:
Join hosts Cliff Perott and Jonathan D Nicholas as they present another informative episode of the Property Beat. You remember hearing about Mortgage Fraud, right? You might even be under the impression that it doesnt happen anymore now that weve worked our way through the latest financial meltdown, but youd be wrong in that assumption. Anthony "Tony" Accetta, a previous Assistant U.S. Attorney, experienced litigator, and founding member of the Accetta Group, has successfully prosecuted over $2 Billion in mortgage fraud schemes. Today, the Accetta Group is a leading financial oversight consultant to lending organizations, mortgage companies, pension funds, and muncipalities. When engaging a client, the Accetta Groups mission is to "examine, test, probe and disclose the facts behind the facts." Mortgage fraud is unacceptable in any financial services company - and the Accetta Group consults with expertise on preventative measures in order to protect the reputation of their clients. The large rewards available to investors in both prime and subprime mortage markets have led to trilions of dollars of investments in mortgages, securitizations, and various forms of derivatives. Accompanying these opportunities has been a new fraud industry which to date has cost investors, insurers, and the public hundreds of billions of dollars. The Accetta Group warned several now defunct investment and mortgage lending banks to slow down and establish quality control in their origination processes.

item.title: Luxury Real Estate Trends & Lifestyle Preferences - May 05,2012
item.description:
Join hosts Cliff Perotti and Jonathan Nicholas as they talk real estate with Paul Boomsma, President of Luxury Portfolio International, and COO of Leading Real Estate Companies of the World. With over 20 years of experience in luxury real estate, Paul Boomsma has created the highly successful Luxury Portfolio program for LeadingRE. Paul began his career marketing luxury office towers and later joined a top residential firm, later becoming National Marketing Director for a major franchise. Paul is a frequent industry speaker on the topics of raising the bar for real estate branding, agent listing presentations, synergies with the resort/second-home market, and the luxury market. He has been named one of the Most Influential People in Luxury Real Estate and has received Unique Homes’ Luxury Marketer of the Year Award. Listen to Paul as he gives us insight into luxury real estate trends, who is buying luxury properties, and where they are buying them.

item.title: Foreclosure or Insurance Disputes - Meet Chris Parrington - Dec 01,2011
item.description:
Join host Cliff Perotti on The Property Beat as he explores the crazy world of foreclosure and insurance disputes with special guest, Minneapolis attorney Chris Parrington. Chris has helped numerous homeowners resolve issues with both their lenders and insurers. As a regular guest on "All Things Real Estate" (radio show produced by an org named #1 fastest growing biz in Minnesota by INC. magazine) he is engaging, entertaining and is able to make these complex issues understandable. Were excited to have Chris on our show!

item.title: Avoid Condo Buying Pitfalls - Patrick Hohman Shares Insights - Nov 17,2011
item.description:
Join host Cliff Perotti as he talks about the potential pitfalls of buying condominiums, or any other type of common interest development with guest Patrick Hohman, a 24-year condo association volunteer President and Author of "Condos Townhomes and Home Owner Associations: How to make your investment safer." Youll learn... What to look for when you buy into "shared expenses" housing, like condos, townhomes and home owner associations! The 5 key elements in the best run associations! The training needed for the almost 2 million Americans who volunteer on their board of directors at condos, townhomes and home owner associations! If you own a condo, or are thinking about buying one, you wont want to miss this show!

item.title: Luxury Home Auctions - Laura BradyTells All! - Nov 02,2011
item.description:
Join hosts Cliff Perotti and Jonathan Nicholas here at The Property Beat as they explore the world of luxury home auctions with guest Laura Brady, VP Marketing of Concierge Auctions. Concierge Auctions has a database that includes more than 10,000 luxury real estate buyers and agents from all 50 states and 38 countries and territories, and has been involved in the transfer of more than $2 billion in luxury real estate sales over the past 10 years. While real estate auction services have been around for a long time, the luxury niche seems to be discovering their importance during these challenging times. Do homes sell for more with an auction? Or can buyers get a steal at the block? Plug in those earphones and tune in for the inside scoop on luxury home auctions!

item.title: Helping Family Members Make Their Last Move - Jane Lott - Aug 31,2011
item.description:
Join hosts Cliff Perotti and Jonathan Nicholas as they talk with Jane Lott about the sensitive issues that we will all eventually face when we have to assist moving our loved ones out of their longtime homes and into assisted living facilities. Special guest Jane Lott, founder of silver rain a state transition services, joins us on the property beat to talk about the various aspects of estate transitions, including dealing with a home, transition of lifestyle, asset management, asset protection and the difficult coordination of multiple services needed to help a parent or relative, or their estate.

item.title: The Las Vegas Market Facts vs. Fiction - Guest Dave Tina - Aug 24,2011
item.description:
Join hosts Cliff Perotti and Jonathan Nicholas as they explore the truth about the current condition of the Las Vegas, Nevada real estate market. They are joined by guest Dave Tina, President/CEO of Realty One Group, a four office, 1600 agent company in the Greater Las Vegas marketplace. Dave Tina, a native New Yorker and former firefighter, traded hoses for houses and entered the real estate scene in 1977. He worked on Long Island for 20 years before relocating to Las Vegas. After meeting Kuba Jewgieniew, president and CEO of Realty One Group, he was impressed with the companys model and signed on to lead one of now four area branches. Tina is also a founding member of UNICO Las Vegas, an Italian-American heritage and community service organization.

item.title: Getting "The Skinny" on Real Estate with Guest Jim Randel - Aug 03,2011
item.description:
Join hosts Cliff Perotti and Jonathan Nicholas as they talk real estate with noted entrepreneur, author and national speaker, Jim Randel. Jim Randel, a graduate of the Columbia University School of Law, has made his living as an entrepreneur. During his 30-year career, Randel has been the lead investor in many real estate and business deals. Randel has also been a teacher and writer. Three years ago he wrote Confessions of a Real Estate Entrepreneur (McGraw-Hill, 2006) which reached #1 in several Amazon categories. One well-known reviewer rated this book a “12 on a scale of 10.” Randel has been a guest speaker at Harvard and NYU Business Schools, annual conventions for national organizations, and investor sessions in every large city in the United States. He has appeared on numerous networks as an expert on investing including ABC, CBS, Fox, CNBC, Fox Business and BetterTV.com. In 2008 Randel retired from his investment activities and formed a new media company, RAND Publishing, to create books to help people understand critical financial and personal principles for success – presented in a concise and entertaining format. These books, called The Skinny On Books are receiving enormous nationwide, critical acclaim from educators, reviewers, bloggers and journalists. In June of 2009, Randel’s first book in the RAND Publishing series, The Skinny on the Housing Crisis, was awarded the Gold Medal in a book competition sponsored by NAREE, a group of 600 journalists who cover business and finance. Randel received the award in Washington, D.C.

item.title: Let's Talk Sales with Tom Hopkins - Jul 20,2011
item.description:
Join hosts Cliff Perotti and Jonathan Nicholas as they talk real estate and sales skills with special guest, Tom Hopkins. As a veteran with 30+ years in sales and sales management, Tom Hopkins is one of the most highly acclaimed authorities on the subject of professional selling in the world today. Over four million students around the world have studied with Tom in his sales training seminars. His first book, “How to Master the Art of Selling™” has sold over 1.4 million copies, which makes it the best selling book ever on the subject of “how-to” selling techniques. Hundreds of thousands of salespeople drive through their sales territories daily with Tom Hopkins helping them turn their cars into classrooms. Over 10,000 businesses around the world let Tom train their salespeople via his video training systems and now they can do so over the net with his online training courses.

item.title: Real Estate Murder Mystery? You Bet! Meet Nancy Lynn Jarvis - Jun 29,2011
item.description:
Join hosts Cliff Perotti and Jonathan Nicholas as they talk real estate with leading trend setters in the real estate industry. In this show, they talk with special guest and Realtor-now-mystery-writer, Nancy Lynn Jarvis. Her four mystery books are centered on a Santa Cruz Realtor (and part time detective) named Regan McHenry and his sometimes gruesome discoveries. Nancy Lynn Jarvis is turning some heads and getting some great reviews on her books, entitled: The Death Contingency Backyard Bones Buying Murder The Widows Walk League This should be a fun hour! You can join in the conversation at The Property Beat!

item.title: The Future of Real Estate with John Martorana - Jun 22,2011
item.description:
Join hosts Cliff Perotti and Jonathan D. Nicholas as they tackle the subject of where this market is going and the trends that well see along the way. Theyll be joined by their special guest, John Martorana, the founder and CEO of Oxford Communications. Twenty-five years ago, John build his advertising and marketing agency around real estate - active adult, new construction, realty offices, etc. In the two-plus decades since John launched Oxford Communications, he has seen it all. As an insider who has worked with countless builders, developers and realtors, John offers keen insight on trends in the market, where he sees real estate moving and when it will get there. Any agent or builder can tell you their tale, but theyre too close. John is a dispassionate observer of nearly three decades of real estate and development, and privy to some of the best inside information there is. Who better to give your listeners the unvarnished truth and insight?

item.title: The Consumer Evolution Revolution with Julie Garton Good - Jun 01,2011
item.description:
Over the last two decades, consumer expectations have leapt ahead of the slow-to-move real estate industry status quo. This has in turn created a disconnect between what the typical consumer needs, and what the average real estate agent delivers. Sometimes, a traditional real estate transaction is not the best solution for all parties. Enter Julie Garton Good, a consumer advocate and "Americas Home Affordability Expert." Julie has been leading the charge for new ways of doing business, and dragging the real estate industry along with her. Join hosts Cliff Perotti and Jonathan D. Nicholas as they interview Julie Garton Good, voted one of the 25 most influential people in real estate by REALTOR Magazine.

item.title: "The Truth Behind Real Estate Appraisals" with James Manning - May 04,2011
item.description:
Join hosts Cliff Perotti and Jonathan Nicholas as they talk real estate values and the challenges of the appraisal system in the U.S. with guest James E. Manning, author of Public Trust Betrayed: The Truth Behind the Real Estate Appraisal Industry. Mannings new book emphasizes that there must be transparency and objectivity in the mortgage and evaluation process if we are to solve the current credit crisis and what we must change in the financial industry to prevent another economic meltdown. As a result of fraud, conflicts of interest, over-valuations, and lax underwriting standards, the entire lending industry must be examined and changed if any meaningful housing recovery is to be accomplished.

item.title: Fliponomics: The Art of the Flip Transaction - Apr 27,2011
item.description:
Join us for a special edition of The Property Beat as we explore the ups and downs of the highly volatile "flip" real estate transaction. We will be joined by real estate entrepreneur and professor of "Flip-o-nomics," D. Sidney Potter who will share his story of going from zero to hero, then back to zero again during the turbulent downturn of the real estate market. His insights are invaluable to those desiring to jump into the real estate investment game. He shares with us key advice, and some hard learned mistakes that will help any person interested in real estate. Potter is the author of "The Flip" a book which memorializes the market bust, and how a tract home investor and mentor to many practically went broke. The book reads like a novel, and a how-to guide for those wanting to leverage the opportunities presented in todays market.

item.title: Are You a Victim of Loan Modifcation Fraud? Meet your warrior...Guest Alan Sims - Mar 30,2011
item.description:
Join Cliff Perotti and Jonathan Nicholas as they talk with Alan Sims, CEO for The Center for Litigation and Consumer Real Estate Education (CLCREE). His organization educates homeowners who may have been victims of predatory lending, loan modifications scams, and other related real estate issues. Alan R. Sims has worked as a forensic real estate appraiser and expert witness for the past 17 years. He formed the Alan R. Sims Appraising firm in 1993 after an extensive career as an engineer in the fields of telecommunications and sonar development while serving in the U. S. Navy. As a forensic real estate appraiser, Mr. Sims grew frustrated by seeing the real estate market decline, but more importantly, seeing some of his clients losing their homes to predatory lending and other unscrupulous real estate practices. For the past several years he volunteered to advise the public on a plan of action. As the calls came from all over California (and from all over the country), he recognized a need to form The Center for Litigation & Consumer Real Estate Education in an effort to assist the public. Alan's fought the good fight on behalf of consumers and he's got some stories to share. Join us!

item.title: Bill Meagher Joins The Property Beat - May 26,2010
item.description:
The Property Beat…Where the coffee is hot and we’re talking real estate. Join hosts Cliff Perotti and Jonathan Nicholas as they discuss today's real estate issues. This week's guest is Bill Meagher, whose work has appeared in newspapers and magazines throughout California as well as on PBS and CBS. He covers commercial real estate and finance on a national basis for Dealflow Media. He is a contributing editor for NorthBay biz Magazine as well as writing a monthly column. He has written a novel and is currently at work on his second book. Ask your questions and get your answers. Join in!
